segments.text: What arcanists regard to be more important is the knowledge from another pathway, which is often known as Gnosis. Compared with mankind's knowledge gained from reasoning, what are the features of Gnosis?
segments.translation: 마도학자들이 더 중요하게 여기는 것은 다른 경로의 지식, 흔히 영지라고 불리는 것이지. 추론을 통해 얻은 인류의 지식과 비교했을 때, 영지의 특징은 무엇일까?

segments.text: Sonetto.
segments.translation: 소네트.

segments.text: Miss, the features of Gnosis are: one, it can not be verified by an independent third party; and two, it is impossible to be comprehended through reasoning.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 선생님, 영지의 특징은 첫째, 독립적인 제3자에 의해 검증될 수 없으며, 둘째, 이성적 사고를 통해 이해하는 것이 불가능하다는 점입니다.

segments.text: Exactly. And that's also one of the reasons that the knowledge of the study of arcanum is hard to be accepted by the academic world.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 맞습니다. 그리고 그것이 바로 마도학 연구 지식이 학계에서 받아들여지기 어려운 이유 중 하나이기도 합니다.

segments.text: The academic research is required to be open to the public and can pass the independent tests, but the unpredictability of arcanum will lead the arcane researches to "methodological agnosticism."
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 학술 연구는 대중에게 공개되어야 하고 독립적인 검증을 통과할 수 있어야 하지만, 마도술의 예측 불가능성은 마도학 연구를 방법론적 불가지론으로 이끌게 될 것이다.

segments.text: Thus, all the trainings and the scientific stabilizing appliances that the school provided for you is to overcome the instability of your arcane skill, in order to insure the peace and stability of human world.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 따라서 학교에서 여러분에게 제공하는 모든 훈련과 과학적 안정화 장치들은 여러분의 마도술의 불안정성을 극복하여 인간 세계의 평화와 안정을 보장하기 위한 것입니다.

segments.text: May the peace be with us.
segments.speaker: All Students
segments.translation: 평화가 우리와 함께하길.

segments.text: Urgh ... I was almost quick enough to answer that question. How could, how could she be so fast …
segments.translation: 으... 거의 답할 뻔했는데. 어떻게, 어떻게 쟤가 그렇게 빠를 수가...

segments.text: Next question. After the fall of the Roman Empire, the number of arcanists, along with the related literature, had reduced correspondingly. Who can tell us the history of that time in brief?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 다음 문제다. 로마 제국이 멸망한 후, 마도술사들의 수는 관련 문헌과 함께 그에 상응하여 감소했다. 그 시대의 역사를 간략히 설명해줄 수 있는 사람?

segments.text: Miiiss! Miiiiiiiiss!
segments.translation: 선생님! 선생님!

segments.text: I-I ... Miss, I know this one!
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 저... 저요... 선생님, 아는 문제에요!

segments.text: Aww …

As the Roman Empire declined, some arcanists were tempted by their irrational side of their nature and applied Magia Naturalis in warfare and disputes over interests, which irritated the Church and other powers of religion.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 로마 제국이 쇠퇴하면서 일부 마도학자들은 본성의 비이성적인 면에 유혹되어 자연 마법을 전쟁과 이익 분쟁에 활용했고, 이는 교회와 기타 종교 세력의 분노를 샀습니다.

segments.text: At that time, people in Europe widely considered arcanum to be the paganism "that collaborates with the demons", hence the trials against arcanists.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 당시 유럽에서는 보편적으로 마도술을 악마와 접촉하는 이교 숭배 행위로 보았고, 더 나아가 마도학자를 심판하기도 했습니다.

segments.text: In response, arcanists struck back fiercely. However, due to their spontaneous character and the unpredictability of their whereabouts, their communication was unsuccessful during the fight …
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이에 마도학자들은 맹렬하게 반격했지만, 그들의 즉흥적인 성격과 예측 불가능한 거취로 인해 전투 중 소통에 실패했고…

segments.text: Both sides struggled in repeated battles. In the end, mankind, jointly led by both their religious and secular leaders, prevailed.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 몇 단계 전황이 반복된 끝에 결국 종교계와 세속계로 대표되는 인류가 승리했습니다.

segments.text: That can't be ... That's not how Grandpa told me …
segments.translation: 아니야... 할아버지가 예전에 말씀하신 거랑 달라...

segments.text: Miss! She's wrong. I know, I know the right answer!
segments.translation: 선생님! 쟤가 말한 거 틀렸어요. 제가 알아요... 제가 정답 알아요!

segments.text: Alright. Give it a try, Matilda.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 좋아. 한번 해봐, 마틸다.

segments.text: For what I know, it wasn't arcanists who started the war! The attack on Constantinople was waged by lordships in Western Europe to ransack the capital for resources and the literature of arcanum.
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 내가 아는 바로는, 전쟁을 시작한 건 마도사들이 아니야! 콘스탄티노플 공격은 서유럽의 영주들이 수도의 자원과 마도학 문헌을 약탈하기 위해 벌인 거라고.

segments.text: The nursery rhyme my grandpa sang for me tells me all about it!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 할아버지가 불러주신 자장가에 그 모든 게 나와 있어!

segments.text: And! Long ago, arcanists weren't called by this name ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 그리고! 아주 오래전에는 마도술사들을 이런 이름으로 부르지 않았어...

segments.text: They were once gifted philosophers, diviners, or doctors ... until they were put on the labels of "pagans," "freaks," and "witches" and isolated by their people …
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 그들은 한때 재능 있는 철학자, 점술사, 의사들이었지... 하지만 이교도, 괴물, 마녀라는 낙인이 찍혀 사람들로부터 격리당했어...

segments.text: They were entirely forgotten. The next time people saw them, they had this new name—arcanists.
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 그들은 완전히 잊혀졌어. 사람들이 다시 그들을 봤을 때는 새로운 이름이 붙어 있었지—마도사라고.

segments.text: Inspiring. Do you remember its name?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 인상적이군. 그것의 이름을 기억하나?

segments.text: Err ... Grandpa never told me that …
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 어... 할아버지는 그런 말씀 안 하셨는데...

segments.text: How about the melody? Could you present several lines for the class?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 멜로디는 어때? 수업을 위해 몇 소절 들려줄 수 있겠어?

segments.text: Let me think. It was like ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 음... 생각해보니까 그건...

segments.text: That's weird ... I-I can't remember it ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 이상해... 기-기억이 안 나...

segments.text: Haha! Don't remember a thing but still feel confident enough to answer the question. Shame on you, little thing!
segments.speaker: Student A
segments.translation: 하하! 아무것도 기억 안 나면서 질문에 답할 자신은 있다고? 부끄러운 줄 알아야지, 꼬마야!

segments.text: I was even humming the rhyme last night! It just ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 어젯밤에도 그 동요를 흥얼거렸는데! 그런데...

segments.text: Sit down please, Matilda.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 앉으세요, 마틸다.

segments.text: Sonetto is correct.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 소네트가 맞다.

segments.text: Matilda, you have just transferred here. It may take you some time to get used to our curriculum.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 마틸다, 너는 방금 전학 온 학생이야. 우리 교육과정에 익숙해지는 데 시간이 좀 걸릴 거다.

segments.text: A rhyme can be used in studying folklore, but it's still different from a formal historical intelligence.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 운율은 민속학 연구에 활용할 수 있지만, 정식 역사 정보와는 여전히 다르다.

segments.text: Class, please turn to the last question of the test.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 여러분, 시험지 마지막 문제로 넘어가세요.

segments.text: After the Ottoman Empire seized control over Constantinople, Georgios Gemistos, a member of our Sharan Commune, also an arcanist and philosopher of the Roman Empire, traveled to Florence.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 오스만 제국이 콘스탄티노플을 장악한 후, 우리 샤란 코뮌의 일원이자 로마 제국의 마도술사이며 철학자였던 게오르기오스 게미스토스가 피렌체로 떠났다.

segments.text: He brought one classical literature of ancient Theurgy into the city, which sparked discussion and later brought about the annual humanists gathering—the Chaldean Conference, where the study of arcanum was debated over its use for mankind development.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 그는 고대 신학의 고전 문학 작품 하나를 도시로 가져왔고, 이것이 논의를 불러일으켜 후에 연례 인문학자 모임인 칼데아 회의를 탄생시켰다. 이 회의에서는 마도학 연구가 인류 발전을 위한 활용에 대해 토론되었지.

segments.text: Who knows the name of this work brought by Gemistos?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 게미스토스가 가져온 이 작품의 이름을 아는 사람?

segments.text: Miiiss, me, me!
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 선생님, 저요, 저요!

segments.text: Miss, please!! I know this one. I do know!!!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 아가씨, 제발요!! 이거 저 알아요. 정말 알고 있다고요!!!

segments.text: Her eyes fall on the desk next to Sonetto. There is a short wall made of books on the desktop.
segments.translation: 그녀의 시선이 소네트의 옆 책상으로 향했다. 책상 위에는 책으로 쌓인 낮은 벽이 있었다.

segments.text: Vertin, do you know the answer to this question?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 버틴, 이 문제의 답을 알고 있나?

segments.text: Vertin?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 버틴?

segments.text: The instructor walks down from the podium.
segments.translation: 교사가 교단에서 내려왔다.

segments.text: ... Vertin. She is absent again?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: ... 버틴. 또 결석인가?

segments.text: Miiiiss, I know the answer!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 선생님~! 저 답 알아요!

segments.text: It is Chaldean Oracles!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 칼데아의 신탁이야!

segments.text: The last class is over.
segments.translation: 마지막 수업이 끝났다.

segments.text: Students leave the classroom with their friends in groups.
segments.translation: 학생들은 삼삼오오 모여 교실을 떠났다.

segments.text: Goodbye, Miss.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 선생님, 안녕히 계세요.

segments.text: ... I will just take another route.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: ...다른 길로 가자.

segments.text: Sonetto!
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 소네트!

segments.text: Come here.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 이리 와 봐.

segments.text: Is my book wall still there? She didn't push it down, right?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 내가 쌓아놓은 책은 그대로야? 선생님이 무너뜨리진 않았겠지...

segments.text: She didn't.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그녀는 그러지 않았어.

segments.text: Phew ... she is nice. Unlike the bad potion instructor who turned my books into a puddle of mud ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 휴우... 정말 좋은 분이구나. 포션 선생님은 진짜 나빠. 책더미를 진흙더미로 만들어버렸다니까...

segments.text: Oh, right! Guess what I found today?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아, 내가 오늘 뭘 찾아냈는지 맞혀볼래?

segments.text: Here, give me your hand.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 자, 손 줘 봐.

segments.text: Look, the foreteller of the rain—the Hyla arborea!
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 봐봐, 장마철을 예고할 수 있는 청개구리야!

segments.text: I caught it through the school's front gate. I even got stung by the electric fence when I took my hands back.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 학교 정문을 통해서 잡았어. 손을 빼면서 전기 울타리에 감전되기까지 했다고.

segments.text: It keeps croaking in my pocket! Look, it's still raining outside.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 개구리가 주머니 안에서도 계속 울었거든. 저기봐, 밖에 지금도 비가 오고 있어.

segments.text: Aren't you aware that you've been given a time-out, Ms. Vertin?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 네가 벌서는 중인 건 알고 있어? 버틴 씨.

segments.text: I don't understand ... why you always skip classes.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 난 이해가 안 돼... 왜 맨날 수업에 안 들어오는 거야?

segments.text: You know that we are not supposed to pay too much attention to affairs outside the school. Please ... don't bring me these pebbles and frogs anymore.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 학교 밖 일에 너무 신경 쓰면 안 된다는 거 알잖아요. 제발... 이런 조약돌이나 개구리 같은 거 더 이상 가져오지 말아요.

segments.text: These are ... meaningless.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이런 건... 전부 무의미해.

segments.text: ... We are born to die martyrs.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: ... 우리는 태어날 때부터 순교자로 죽을 운명이야.

segments.text: ... Why? Just because the Student Handbook says so?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: ...어째서? 학생 수첩에 그렇게 쓰여 있으니까?

segments.text: That's right.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 맞습니다.

segments.text: I don't like the handbook. It smells like those stinky socks in the attic.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 난 이 교범이 마음에 안 들어. 다락방에 있는 냄새나는 양말 같아.

segments.text: Sonetto, aren't you really curious about what is outside the school?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 소네트, 넌 정말 바깥세상의 일이 전혀 궁금하지 않아?

segments.text: You were also in that parade outside the school before ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 넌 학교 밖의 순회공연에도 참여했었잖아...

segments.text: The pebbles, the frogs, the attic with stinky socks ... They're just a teeny tiny part of the whole world. I once met a girl who came to our school ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 조약돌, 개구리, 다락방의 냄새 나는 양말... 이런 건 세상의 아주 작은 일부일 뿐이야. 내가 예전에 우리 학교에 온 여자애를 본 적이 있는데...

segments.text: Pl-please stop.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 제, 제발 그만해줘.

segments.text: These are very dangerous things.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이런 것들은 정말 위험해.

segments.text: The Student Handbook is protecting us.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 학생 수첩이 우리를 지켜주고 있어.

segments.text: It is protecting us from harm and regrets.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 상처와 후회로부터 우리를 지켜주고 있어.

segments.text: As the instructors have told us, to live is to lose things around us until the day we lose life itself to death. That's why we should only focus on the supreme missions.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 교관님들께서 말씀하신 대로, 살아간다는 것은 죽음으로 생명을 잃는 그날까지 주변의 모든 것을 하나씩 잃어가는 것입니다. 그렇기 때문에 우리는 오직 최고의 임무에만 집중해야 합니다.

segments.text: Until the day we lose life itself ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 우리가 생명 자체를 잃는 그날까지...

segments.text: To death?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 죽음을 향해 간다고?

segments.text: Her traumatic segment has been reactivated. Increase the power, stabilize her psychube.
segments.translation: 그녀의 트라우마 구간이 재활성화됐어. 출력을 높이고 사이큐브를 안정화시켜.

segments.text: Try the next dream.
segments.translation: 다음 꿈으로 해보자.

segments.text: The artificial somnambulism therapy may not work on her, Mesmer.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그녀에겐 가상 몽유 치료법이 맞지 않을 수도 있어, 메스머.

segments.text: Hm? You're here, Madam Z.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 음? 여기 계셨군요, Z 부인.

segments.text: All patients who have the symptoms of stress disorder need to receive treatments in the rehabilitation center. Her trauma level was assessed as Type II. I needed to take responsibility for her health.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 스트레스 장애 증상을 보이는 모든 환자들은 재활센터에서 치료를 받아야 해. 그녀의 트라우마 수준은 2급으로 판정됐고. 내가 그녀의 건강에 대해 책임져야 했어.

segments.text: Back in the year when she became the Timekeeper ... she didn't receive any treatment. I know her well. She has enough power in her to make it through.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 버틴은 타임키퍼가 되었을 때... 어떤 치료도 받지 않았어. 난 알아, 버틴에게는 충분한 힘이 있어.

segments.text: I'm just following orders, madam.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 저는 그저 명령을 따르고 있을 뿐입니다, 부인.

segments.text: It's the committee's direct order to treat Vertin.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 버틴을 치료하라는 건 위원회의 직접 명령이야.

segments.text: If you have anything to say, convince the vice president first.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 할 말이 있으면 부회장부터 설득해.

segments.text: She hasn't had any food for days. Give her a glucose injection. I have a meeting later, so if you would excuse me.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 며칠째 식사를 거르고 있으니 포도당 주사를 놔줘. 잠시 후에 회의가 있어서 먼저 실례할게.

segments.text: Madam Z takes her thermos cup and leaves the room.
segments.translation: Z는 휴대용 텀블러를 챙겨 방을 나갔다.

segments.text: The ward becomes silent again. There are barely any other sounds except the slight electrical buzzing.
segments.translation: 병동이 다시 조용해졌다. 희미한 전기 윙윙거리는 소리 외에는 거의 다른 소리가 들리지 않았다.

segments.text: I did expect you would have learned your lesson in such a long time ...
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 이렇게 오랜 시간이 지났으면 교훈을 얻었을 거라고 기대했는데...

segments.text: Timekeeper ... No, I'm more used to calling you Vertin.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 타임키퍼... 아니, 버틴이라고 부르는 게 더 익숙해.

segments.text: I have changed.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 나는 변했어.

segments.text: Have you? Are you still suffering from those ... pointless things?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 그랬어? 아직도 그런... 무의미한 것들 때문에 괴로워하고 있는 거야?

segments.text: She shakes her head; her eyes shift onto the screen.
segments.translation: 그녀는 고개를 저으며 화면으로 시선을 옮겼다.

segments.text: The psychube amplitude is leaping in a repeated, fixed pattern; Vertin doesn't give her response.
segments.translation: 사이큐브의 진폭이 반복적이고 고정된 패턴으로 요동치고 있다. 버틴은 아무런 대답을 하지 않는다.

segments.text: Hello, this is Sonetto, the chief assistant of the Foundation's Timekeeper. My employee number is SF38000000801102Y. Could you please register a visit to Ward 1525 for me?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 안녕하세요. 전 재단의 타임키퍼 제1 조수 소네트, 직원 번호는 SF38000000801102Y입니다. 1525실 병동을 방문할 수 있도록 방문 자격을 등록해주세요.

segments.text: Please present your ID.
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 신분증을 제시해 주세요.

segments.text: Hold that crystal with your right hand until the color changes.
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 오른손으로 그 수정을 잡고 색이 바뀔 때까지 기다려 주세요.

segments.text: O-okay.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 어, 알겠습니다.

segments.text: What is the shape of the sun, a sphere or a cube?
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 태양의 모양이 뭐죠, 구체인가요 정육면체인가요?

segments.text: A sphere.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 원형입니다.

segments.text: Which is edible, rubber, cabbage, or Carbuncle?
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 고무, 양배추, 카벙클 중에서 먹을 수 있는 건 뭘까요?

segments.text: Cabbage.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 배추입니다.

segments.text: Does the rain come down from the sky or the other way around?
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 비는 하늘에서 내리는 건가요, 아니면 그 반대인가요?

segments.text: ... Can be both.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: ...둘 다 가능합니다.

segments.text: You're good to go.
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 이제 가셔도 됩니다.

segments.text: Take these materials with you. The Visitor Guide is between the second page and third page. Go in from the left, turn right twice, and take the lift. Keep walking, and you will see the ward.
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 이 자료들을 가져가세요. 방문자 안내서는 두 번째 페이지와 세 번째 페이지 사이에 있어요. 왼쪽으로 들어가서 오른쪽으로 두 번 돌아간 다음 엘리베이터를 타세요. 계속 걸어가시면 병동이 보일 거예요.

segments.text: I see. Thank you. Is there anything else I should know?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 네, 감사합니다. 제가 따로 주의해야 할 사항이 있을까요?

segments.text: Just leave the number out next time.
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 다음엔 번호는 빼고 해주세요.

segments.text: Will you?
segments.speaker: Receptionist
segments.translation: 그러실 건가요?

segments.text: The receptionist disappears once again behind the counter.
segments.translation: 접수원이 다시 한번 카운터 뒤로 사라졌다.

segments.text: The nurses seem busy here.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 여기 간호사는 다들 바빠 보이네.

segments.text: The registration is also more rigorous than it was before. I wonder if this is because of the "Storm" ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 등록 절차도 예전보다 훨씬 까다로워졌어. 폭풍우와 관련 있는 건 아닐까...

segments.text: Turn right again ... hm? But there is only one way and it goes left.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이제 두 번째 우회전... 어? 여긴 좌회전 통로밖에 없는데?

segments.text: Did I miss any crossings?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 내가 방금 갈림길을 지나쳐왔나?

segments.text: Sonetto looks back over her shoulder. A shadow swiftly disappears around the corner.
segments.translation: 소네트가 어깨 너머로 뒤를 돌아본다. 그림자 하나가 모퉁이 너머로 재빠르게 사라진다.

segments.text: What's that?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 저건 뭐지?

segments.text: She goes to the corner. There's only a machine with a shaking console.
segments.translation: 그녀가 모퉁이로 갔다. 계기판이 흔들리는 기기만 있을 뿐이었다.

segments.text: Maybe I'm seeing things.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 내가 착각한 모양이네.

segments.text: The buildings of Laplace Scientific Computing Center have been cleverly designed.
segments.translation: 라플라스 과학 연구소의 건물은 아주 정교하게 설계되었다.

segments.text: A crossing is hidden in this corner.
segments.translation: 갈림길 하나가 이쪽 코너에 숨겨져 있다.

segments.text: Hm? So here is the junction to the right ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 어? 이거 우측으로 도는 갈림길 아니야? 여기 있었구나...

segments.text: Sonetto walks to the junction and disappears into the light.
segments.translation: 소네트가 갈림길로 걸어가 빛 속으로 사라진다.

segments.text: Behind her, one of the doors in the hallway opens. A shadow follows her into the light.
segments.translation: 그녀의 뒤에서 복도의 문 하나가 열렸다. 그림자 하나가 그녀를 따라 빛 속으로 들어왔다.

segments.text: Footsteps. Sometimes near, sometimes far.
segments.translation: 발소리가 들린다. 때로는 가깝게, 때로는 멀리서.

segments.text: It follows Sonetto.
segments.translation: 소네트를 따라간다.

segments.text: Speeding up ...
segments.translation: 속도를 높인다...

segments.text: It speeds up.
segments.translation: 속도가 빨라진다.

segments.text: Slowing down ...
segments.translation: 속도를 늦춘다...

segments.text: It slows down as well.
segments.translation: 상대도 느려졌다.

segments.text: Well then ...
segments.translation: 그렇다면...

segments.text: Let's go faster, and faster.
segments.translation: 빠르게, 좀 더 빠르게 걷는다.

segments.text: Until the shoes are about to be lifted out from the ground, and even the ankles are starting to hurt. Go quickly, and more quickly, qui ...
segments.translation: 신발이 땅에서 떨어져 나갈 듯하고, 발목까지 아프기 시작했다. 빨리, 더 빨리 가야 한다, 빨...

segments.text: ... And now, run!
segments.translation: ... 그리고 이제, 뛰어!

segments.text: Phew ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto

segments.text: Press every button here to buy some time ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 모든 층을 한 번씩 눌러서 최대한 시간을 끌자...

segments.text: Who was that? Could be a disoriented patient ... or a Manus's spy? Or ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 누가 날 미행하는 거지? 정신질환 환자? 재건의 스파이? 아니면...

segments.text: I can't get away from "it."
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 난 녀석에게서 벗어날 수 없어.

segments.text: And I will not bring danger to the Timekeeper.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그리고 타임키퍼를 위험에 빠뜨리지 않을 거야.

segments.text: I will catch this person.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 내가 이 사람을 잡아야 해.

segments.text: The elevator stops at the 15th floor. It's rather empty and spacious here.
segments.translation: 엘리베이터가 15층에서 멈췄다. 이곳은 공간이 굉장히 넓었다.

segments.text: One can only hear Sonetto's footsteps, aside from the evergoing automatic broadcasts in the building.
segments.translation: 건물 안에서 계속 흘러나오는 자동 방송 소리 외에는 소네트의 발걸음 소리만 들려왔다.

segments.text: The rehabilitation Center is established to provide effective medical services and trainings to the patients, for their bodily functions to be restored.
segments.speaker: Broadcast
segments.translation: 재활 센터는 환자들에게 효과적인 의료 서비스와 훈련을 제공하여 신체 기능을 회복시키기 위해 설립되었습니다.

segments.text: This center is managed by Laplace Scientific Computing Center; if you have any special requirements or have encountered any suspicious persons, please move to the ground floor lobby for help.
segments.speaker: Broadcast
segments.translation: 이 센터는 라플라스 과학 컴퓨팅 센터에서 관리하고 있습니다. 특별한 요청 사항이 있거나 수상한 인물을 목격하신 경우, 1층 로비로 이동하여 도움을 요청해 주시기 바랍니다.

segments.text: If you are distant from the lobby, please press the yellow button next to the fire hose cabinets. The security on your floor will come to assist shortly.
segments.speaker: Broadcast
segments.translation: 로비에서 멀리 떨어져 계시다면, 소화전 함 옆에 있는 노란색 버튼을 눌러주세요. 해당 층의 보안 요원이 곧 도움을 드리러 갈 것입니다.

segments.text: The footsteps appear again.
segments.translation: 다시 발소리가 들려왔다.

segments.text: They're here.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 왔군.

segments.text: I don't see any cabinets ... That's fine.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이 주변엔 캐비닛이 없는데... 하지만, 괜찮아.

segments.text: If no help or assistance has come to you in time, you may take action to defend yourself. A free wake-up procedure will be administered on any unresponsive persons if any.
segments.speaker: Broadcast
segments.translation: 제때 도움이나 지원이 오지 않는다면, 자신을 보호하기 위해 행동을 취해도 됩니다. 반응하지 않는 사람이 있을 경우 무료 각성 절차가 시행될 예정입니다.

segments.text: Good, just what I need.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 좋아, 마음에 들어.

segments.text: The sanitary trolley is parked at the next turn. I've left the biggest garbage bag on it.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 다음 코너에 청소 카트가 세워져 있어. 내가 제일 큰 쓰레기봉투를 위에 올려놨지.

segments.text: She suddenly speeds up and quickly turns into the corner.
segments.translation: 갑자기 속도를 높인 그녀가 모퉁이에서 휙, 하고 지나갔다.

segments.text: The unknown follower becomes anxious and runs to the corner ...
segments.translation: 정체불명의 미행자가 불안해하며 모퉁이로 달려간다...

segments.text: Hey ...!
segments.speaker: Sonetto

segments.text: Whoaa ...!
Who are you? Speak up ...! Why are you following me?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 너 누구야? 어서 말해! 왜 날 미행하는 거야!

segments.text: Aww ...
The follower refuses to respond. It clutches the bag to cover its face and tries desperately to escape.
segments.translation: 상대는 대답하지 않았다. 녀석은 뒤집어쓴 봉투 끄트머리를 꽉 붙든 채 도망치려고 시도했다.

segments.text: Stop! You're not getting away!
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 멈춰! 도망치게 두지 않을 거야!

segments.text: The bag is struggling with all efforts. This is a battle of dignity.
segments.translation: 봉투가 온 힘을 다해 몸부림쳤다. 이것은 존엄을 건 싸움이었다.

segments.text: Sonetto feels it is slipping away from her grasp, so she pulls out her wand ...
segments.translation: 소네트는 그것이 자신의 손아귀에서 빠져나가는 것을 느끼고, 지팡이를 꺼내들었다...

segments.text: Whoever you are ... May the peace be with us!
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 네가 누구든... 평화가 우리와 함께하길!

segments.text: Ma-Matilda ...? It's you?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 마, 마틸다...? 네가 왜!

segments.text: I'm sorry! I-I ... thought it was someone suspicious, so ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 미안해! 나, 난 수상한 사람인 줄 알고...

segments.text: Matilda buries her face in her palms and shrugs her shoulders.
segments.translation: 마틸다는 얼굴을 감싸며 어깨를 들썩거렸다.

segments.text: Matilda ... Are you alright?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 마틸다... 괜찮아?

segments.text: Matilda gives Sonetto a push and steps back. Her face blushes.
segments.translation: 마틸다가 소네트를 밀쳐내고 뒤로 물러난다. 그녀의 얼굴이 붉어진다.

segments.text: Sonetto! How dare you!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 소네트! 감히 어떻게!

segments.text: Attacked the monitor student in Primary Defense, and disturbed the peace in public, YOU!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 기초 방어학 수업에서 반장을 공격하고, 공공장소에서 소란을 피웠지, 너 말이야!

segments.text: As your classmate used-to-be, I'm obliged to stop you from making a scene here and disturbing the patients!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 예전 같은 반 친구로서, 여기서 소란 피우며 환자들을 방해하는 건 막아야겠어!

segments.text: I'm, I'm here to give you my warning ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 저, 저는 당신에게 경고를 하러 온 거예요...

segments.text: She suddenly runs towards the other end of the hallway before Sonetto can possibly react to it and do something.
segments.translation: 소네트가 반응해서 뭔가 할 수 있기도 전에 그녀는 갑자기 복도 반대편으로 달려갔다.

segments.text: Please wait ...!
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 잠깐만요...!

segments.text: Bump ...!
Ouch!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 아야!

segments.text: Oh, isn't it the "Sonneteer"? And ... our outstanding graduate.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 오, 이거 소네티어가 아닌가? 그리고... 우리의 뛰어난 졸업생이군.

segments.text: I thought it was some acute mania patient getting out, waiting for my fancy transcranial magnetic stimulation therapy.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 급성 조증 환자가 탈출한 줄 알았네, 내 멋진 경두개 자기자극 치료를 기다리고 있을 거라고 말이야.

segments.text: Err ... it hurts.
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 어... 아파.

segments.text: Wh-what! Sonneteer?! How would I have anything to do with her ...?!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 뭐-뭐라고! 소네티어?! 내가 그녀와 무슨 상관이 있다고...?!

segments.text: I'm Matilda Bouanich, the Top 3 student in school, the monitor assistant, and the speaker of graceful French!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 저는 마틸다 부아니치예요. 학교 성적 3등, 반장 보조, 그리고 우아한 프랑스어의 화자죠!

segments.text: None shall forget my name after making the acquaintance of me!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 나와 인연을 맺은 자라면 누구든 내 이름을 잊지 못할 거야!

segments.text: I didn't, but I guess no one will remember the third place.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 안 했지만, 3등은 아무도 기억 안 할 거 같네.

segments.text: Wha-
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 뭐-

segments.text: Go away, go! Don't stand in my way!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 저리 가, 가라고! 내 앞길을 막지 마!

segments.text: Matilda! Please take ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 마틸다! 이거 받아...

segments.text: Matilda runs away without looking back. Sonetto stands there, with a handkerchief in her hand. She is about to give it to Matilda.
segments.translation: 마틸다는 뒤를 돌아보지 않고 달아났다. 소네트는 손수건을 든 채 그 자리에 서 있었다. 그녀는 마틸다에게 그것을 건네주려던 참이었다.

segments.text: She just ran away like that? There is even garbage dust on her hair.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 저렇게 그냥 도망쳐 버렸다고? 머리카락에 쓰레기 먼지까지 묻혀 가지고.

segments.text: I didn't know she was the one following me. I shouldn't have acted in haste ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 날 따라온 게 그 애였는지 몰랐어. 성급하게 행동하지 말았어야 했는데...

segments.text: Alright, get down to business.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 좋아, 본격적으로 시작해보자.

segments.text: Sonetto, you are here visiting the timekeeper, right?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 소네트, 타임키퍼를 만나러 온 거야?

segments.text: Follow me.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 따라와.

segments.text: Okay.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 네, 알겠습니다.

segments.text: A little bird told me you went to visit Vertin, is that right?
segments.translation: 소문에 버틴을 만나러 갔다던데, 맞아?

segments.text: Yes.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 네.

segments.text: How was she doing?
segments.translation: 어땠어?

segments.text: Just like the other patients.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 다른 환자들과 똑같습니다.

segments.text: Unconscious.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 혼수상태죠.

segments.text: Artificial Somnambulism Therapy shall be good for her.
segments.translation: 인공 몽유 치료법이 그녀에게 좋을 거야.

segments.text: It's been four years since she became the Timekeeper. She surely needs a break.
segments.translation: 타임키퍼가 된 지 벌써 4년이나 됐어. 분명 휴식이 필요할 거야.

segments.text: Yes, and I have no other opinion about this, Madam Vice President.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 네, 저도 이에 대해 다른 의견은 없습니다, 부회장님.

segments.text: I'm here for another issue.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이번에는 다른 일 때문에 온 겁니다.

segments.text: Madam Z places a stack of files on the desk.
segments.translation: Z가 책상 위에 서류 뭉치를 올려놓았다.

segments.text: The proposal of additional manpower submitted by the House of Integratus ... I have given it consideration. It's not worth a committee hearing.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 인테그라투스 가문에서 제출한 추가 인력 배치 제안서... 검토해봤다. 위원회 회의를 열 가치도 없군.

segments.text: Are you here to talk about dead plans?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 죽은 계획에 대해 이야기하러 온 거야?

segments.text: Yes, because I have the exact opposite view.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 네, 제 생각은 반대이기 때문입니다.

segments.text: Vertin's suitcase will not be affected by the "Storm," just like the buildings in our headquarters.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 버틴의 여행 가방은 우리 본부 건물처럼 폭풍우의 영향을 받지 않습니다.

segments.text: Which means she will soon be able to form a team ... indirectly controlled by the Foundation.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이건 그녀가 곧 재단의 간접적인 통제를 받는 팀을 만들 수 있다는 걸 의미하죠.

segments.text: I suggest putting her in command of an independent autonomous unit. With enough support, they should soon become another reliable force of the Foundation.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 저는 그녀에게 독립적인 자율 부대를 맡겨야 한다고 봅니다. 충분한 지원을 통해 재단의 또 다른 믿을 만한 역량으로 키워낼 수 있을 겁니다.

segments.text: And it also facilitates our relationship with Vertin.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이건 우리와 버틴의 관계를 유지하는 데도 도움이 됩니다.

segments.text: The people Vertin brought back with her, who are they?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 버틴이 데려온 사람들, 그들이 누구지?

segments.text: Arcanists who have stable personalities, good command over their arcane skills, and some social experiences.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 안정적인 성격을 지녔으며, 마도학 능력도 능숙하게 사용하고, 사회 경험도 어느 정도 있는 마도학자입니다.

segments.text: If you ask me, they are some pitiful exiles who lost everything in the "Storm."
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 내가 보기엔 폭풍우에서 모든 걸 잃은 불쌍한 유배자들이야.

segments.text: So desperate, horrified, and overwhelmed, longing for something stable to hold on to.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 너무나 절망적이고, 공포에 질리고, 압도당한 채로, 붙잡을 수 있는 안정적인 무언가를 갈망하고 있어.

segments.text: Vertin is not here. Only the Foundation can give them what they want.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 버틴은 여기 없어. 재단만이 그들이 원하는 걸 줄 수 있지.

segments.text: But what can they give us in return?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 하지만 그들이 우리에게 대가로 줄 수 있는 게 뭐가 있지?

segments.text: The innate arbitrariness of arcanists? Or questioning our beliefs of mankind supremacy because they have nobler blood?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 마도사들의 타고난 자의성을 말하는 건가? 아니면 그들이 더 고귀한 혈통을 가졌다고 해서 인류 우월주의에 대한 우리의 신념을 의심하는 건가?

segments.text: Of course, the Foundation needs new blood. Especially those ...
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 물론이지, 재단에는 새로운 피가 필요해. 특히 그런...

segments.text: who are highly obedient and know the importance of order.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 매우 순종적이고 질서의 중요성을 아는 자들 말이야.

segments.text: That's why these poor refugees need no independent unit or autonomy.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그래서 이 불쌍한 난민들에게는 독립적인 조직이나 자치권이 필요하지 않은 거야.

segments.text: They need the guidance of disciplines, a teaching more comprehensive than what's been given to those naive children in school.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그들에게는 규율의 지도가 필요해. 학교에서 그 순진한 아이들에게 주어진 것보다 훨씬 포괄적인 교육 말이야.

segments.text: I see.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 알겠습니다.

segments.text: What you want is a group of dumb puppets.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 당신이 바라는 건 목소리를 내지 못하는 꼭두각시들이죠.

segments.text: I'm always the optimist in the room, and you know that, Ms. Z.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 난 항상 이 자리에서 가장 낙관적인 사람이야, Z 씨도 알잖아.

segments.text: This won't so much be a dead plan if one day they can prove they are not some dumb puppets.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 언젠가 그들이 자신들이 멍청한 꼭두각시가 아니라는 걸 증명할 수 있다면, 이 계획이 그렇게 헛된 것만은 아닐 거야.

segments.text: I didn't follow anyone. I was just taking a walk in the hallway as usual. SHE was the ill-intentioned one ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 누구를 따라간 게 아니야. 그냥 평소처럼 복도를 산책하고 있었을 뿐이라고. 나쁜 마음을 품고 있던 건 그 애였어...

segments.text: It was she who jumped on my back!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 내 등에 뛰어든 건 그 애야!

segments.text: I must have looked miserable when I got away ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 도망칠 때 정말 비참해 보였을 거야...

segments.text: I just wanted to tell her what I read from the latest divination ... The friends they brought may be in danger ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 최근 점술에서 읽은 내용을 그녀에게 전하고 싶었을 뿐이야... 그들이 데려온 친구들이 위험에 처할 수도 있어...

segments.text: Huh ... Don't know when Vertin would be conscious again. She was ... more or less a remarkable person ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 흠... 버틴이 언제 의식을 되찾을지 모르겠네. 그 애는... 어떻게 보면 대단한 사람이었어...

segments.text: Not to mention she is now Sonetto's supervisor! ... Don't know if I should be angry or sad about this.
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 게다가 지금은 소네트의 상관이기까지 하다니! ... 화를 내야 할지 슬퍼해야 할지 모르겠어.

segments.text: Sonetto must be terribly worried about her ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 소네트가 그녀를 얼마나 걱정하고 있을지...

segments.text: Wish I could be of some help.
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 도움이 될 수 있으면 좋을 텐데.

segments.text: It's been a long time since we last met. Her hair has grown and smells nice ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 오랜만에 만나네. 머리카락도 자랐고 좋은 냄새가 나...

segments.text: Aaah!! What did I say ...
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 아아악!! 내가 뭐라고 했는데...

segments.text: Shut it, shut up! You are Matilda, the person who will beat the best in class!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 닥쳐, 입 다물어! 넌 마틸다야, 반에서 최고를 이길 사람이라고!

segments.text: She stops talking to herself and hears the sound of metals clattering near her.
segments.translation: 그녀는 혼잣말을 멈추고 근처에서 금속이 부딪치는 소리를 들었다.

segments.text: Then a wind. An ice-cold wind.
segments.translation: 그리고 온도가 느껴지지 않는 바람이 불어왔다.

segments.text: Skull ...
segments.translation: 해골...

segments.text: A weary voice emerges behind her back. It is a man in a patient's gown.
segments.translation: 그녀의 뒤에서 지친 목소리가 들려온다. 환자복을 입은 남자였다.

segments.text: ...! Who are you?
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: ...! 누구세요?

segments.text: Your skull is falling. I was picking it up for you.
segments.translation: 네 머리가 금방이라도 떨어질 것 같아서 주워주려고.

segments.text: What are you jibber-jabbering about? Are you a patient here? Where's your assigned care worker?
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 뭘 중얼중얼거리는 거야? 너 여기 환자야? 담당 간병인은 어디 있고?

segments.text: I can't let your octahedron fall to the ground too. Be careful with your ears ...!
segments.speaker: Patient
segments.translation: 당신의 팔면체도 땅에 떨어뜨릴 수는 없어. 귀 조심해...!

segments.text: Matilda steps back and moves away from the patient. She notices an iron collar on his neck—a common auxiliary apparatus in the rehabilitation center.
segments.translation: 마틸다는 뒤로 몇 걸음 물러서며 환자에게서 멀어진다. 환자의 목에 쇠고리 같은 게 걸려 있는 것을 발견했다. 재활 센터에서 흔히 볼 수 있는 치료용 보조 도구였다.

segments.text: There is a bunch of keys in his hand, with some red stains on the sharp ends.
segments.translation: 환자는 열쇠 꾸러미를 들고 있었는데 날카로운 부분에 붉은 무언가가 묻어 있었다.

segments.text: Luckily, the emergency button in bright yellow is located a few meters away behind him. Matilda takes a deep breath.
segments.translation: 다행히 노란색 구조 요청 버튼이 환자의 몇 미터 뒤에 있었다. 마틸다는 크게 심호흡했다.

segments.text: Thanks for reminding me. I will take good care of myself.
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 상기시켜 줘서 고마워. 몸조리 잘 할게.

segments.text: See, this is my orb. Come up. Touch it. What's its shape?
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 봐, 이게 내 오브야. 올라와. 만져봐. 모양이 어때?

segments.text: This is ...
segments.speaker: Patient
segments.translation: 이건...

segments.text: ... Arrgh!!
segments.speaker: Patient

segments.text: His fingers turn gray and pale—a sign of frostbite.
segments.translation: 그의 손가락이 회백색으로 변했다. 동상 증상이다.

segments.text: Aahh ...!!
segments.speaker: Patient

segments.text: He tightens his fingers around the keys, like holding many sharpened knives in his hand, and charges at her wildly.
segments.translation: 마치 예리한 칼날을 잡은 것처럼 열쇠를 쥐고 난폭하게 달려들었다.

segments.text: Harrumph, I see you didn't learn your lesson then! You have wounded a caretaker and took the keys. I'm obliged to take you down!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 흥, 그래도 정신을 못 차렸군! 관리인에게 상처를 입히고 열쇠까지 빼앗다니. 널 제압할 수밖에 없겠어!

segments.text: May the peace be with us!
segments.speaker: Matilda
segments.translation: 우리에게 평화가 함께하길!

segments.text: The "Storm" took our friend from us.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 폭풍우가 우리 친구를 데려갔어.

segments.text: In fact, we all knew this would happen. But ... it took place too soon, caught us all off guard.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 사실 다들 마음의 준비를 했다고 생각했는데... 그 친구와의 이별은 너무 갑작스러웠지.

segments.text: And there were only clothes left?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 그럼 옷만 남았다는 거야?

segments.text: ... That's right.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: ...맞습니다.

segments.text: I've looked up the directory of arcanists in the U.S. in 1929. None of their family is on it.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 1929년 미국의 마도학자 명부를 찾아봤는데, 그들 가족은 아무도 등재되어 있지 않았어요.

segments.text: She was Greco's biological daughter. Schneider was a pseudonym.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그 친구는 그렉의 생물학적 친딸이고, 슈나이더는 가명이야.

segments.text: I haven't worked out the reason behind this, but she was indeed ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 구체적인 원인은 아직 밝혀내지 못했지만, 그녀는 분명...

segments.text: Sonetto looks confused and painful.
segments.translation: 소네트는 곤혹스럽고 괴로운 듯 보였다.

segments.text: A human who casts arcane skills.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 마도술을 쓸 수 있는 인간이야.

segments.text: Hmm. Thanks for sharing.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 흠. 얘기해줘서 고마워.

segments.text: It could help with my disease analysis.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 내 질병 분석에 도움이 될 거야.

segments.text: Mesmer Jr. adds something to her report. She spins around on her swivel.
segments.translation: 메스머 주니어는 보고서에 뭔가를 추가하고 의자를 빙빙 돌린다.

segments.text: Timekeeper has been diagnosed with Type II trauma. Do you know what that means?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 타임키퍼가 2형 트라우마 진단을 받았어. 그게 무슨 의미인지 알고 있어?

segments.text: I don't know much about psychology ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 난 심리학에 대해 잘 알지 못해서...

segments.text: It means she had suffered the same traumatic experience repeatedly.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 그 말은 그녀가 같은 트라우마를 반복적으로 겪었다는 뜻이야.

segments.text: Even so, she showed no behavioral or cognitive impairment. Back then, as we held her down and put the helmet on her, she even advised me in an extremely calm manner ...
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 그럼에도 불구하고 그녀는 행동이나 인지 능력에 아무런 장애도 보이지 않았어. 그때 우리가 그녀를 붙잡고 헬멧을 씌울 때도, 그녀는 극도로 침착한 태도로 나에게 조언까지 해줬다고...

segments.text: "I agree with your judgement, but it's just for this time."
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 당신의 판단에 동의하지만, 이번 한 번만이야.

segments.text: ... She was the bellwether of the "break-away" incident after all. I'll say she's been well-behaved this time.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: ... 결국 그녀가 탈주 사건의 주동자였으니까. 이번엔 꽤 얌전했다고 봐야겠네.

segments.text: I-I thought ... Timekeeper is receiving treatment for her low spirit. But you said you held her down ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 난... 타임키퍼가 부정적인 감정 때문에 치료가 필요한 줄 알았어. 그런데 방금 제압했다는 말은...

segments.text: Oh, that's just another description of the method used for the same purpose. The aim was to ensure Vertin was unconscious and taken back.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 아, 그건 같은 목적을 위해 사용된 방법에 대한 또 다른 설명일 뿐이야. 목표는 버틴을 의식불명 상태로 만들어서 데려오는 것이었거든.

segments.text: That's the direct order from the vice president of the committee, Constantine.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 위원회 부회장 콘스탄틴의 직접 명령이야.

segments.text: The order from on high was given on the premise of rational thinking and consideration over pros and cons—you are not questioning the reasoning of mankind, are you?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 위에서 내린 명령은 합리적 사고와 장단점에 대한 신중한 고려를 전제로 한 것이야—설마 인류의 판단력을 의심하는 건 아니겠지?

segments.text: I am not.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 응, 아니야.

segments.text: Sharing the same set of values is the reason I'd like to share these interesting details with you.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 같은 가치관을 공유하고 있기 때문에 이런 흥미로운 이야기들을 당신과 나누고 싶어요.

segments.text: Of course, if you were a pure blood human, I would appreciate you more.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 물론, 당신이 순혈 인간이었다면 더 높이 평가했을 텐데.

segments.text: She turns her swivel to the Artificial Somnambulism device.
segments.translation: 그녀는 의자를 돌려 인공 몽유병 장치와 마주한다.

segments.text: Vertin's magnetic field always maintains a nuanced balance. She barely dreams proactively.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 버틴의 자기장은 항상 미묘한 균형을 유지하고 있어. 그녀는 능동적으로 꿈을 꾸는 일이 거의 없거든.

segments.text: So, I have to deploy different dreams to search for the very first dream, which reflects the source of her trauma.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 그러니까, 그녀의 트라우마 근원을 반영하는 최초의 꿈을 찾기 위해 여러 다른 꿈들을 전개해야 하는 거야.

segments.text: How much longer is this therapy going to take, in your view?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 선생님이 보시기에 이 치료는 얼마나 더 걸릴까요?

segments.text: However long it takes. As long as I receive a new order.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 얼마나 걸리든 상관없어. 새로운 명령만 받을 수 있다면.

segments.text: Sonetto stands up furiously.
segments.translation: 소네트가 화가 나서 벌떡 일어났다.

segments.text: So none of these have been applied for the Timekeeper's wellbeing.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그러니까 이 모든 건 타임키퍼의 건강과는 무관하구나.

segments.text: Yes. What's wrong with you, Sonetto?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 응. 소네트, 너 어디 아픈 데라도 있어?

segments.text: ... I-I don't know.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: ...나, 나도 잘 모르겠어.

segments.text: Sorry, I overreacted. I don't feel quite myself today ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 미안해. 조금 전엔 내가 약간 흥분했어. 약간 불편한 느낌이 들었거든...

segments.text: I can't tell what's wrong. Perhaps I ate something bad for breakfast.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 어떻게 말해야 할지 모르겠네. 아침에 뭔가 잘못 먹어서 그런 걸 수도 있어.

segments.text: Go back and rest if you're feeling unwell. Don't be too hard on yourself.
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 몸이 안 좋으면 돌아가서 쉬어. 너무 무리하지 말고.

segments.text: Thank you. Please take good care of the Timekeeper. I'll be on my way.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 고마워. 타임키퍼를 잘 돌봐줘. 난 먼저 가볼게.

segments.text: Mesmer Jr. watches her walk out of the room. There is confusion on her face. She adjusts her cufflinks subconsciously.
segments.translation: 메스머 주니어는 고개를 갸웃하며 소네트가 떠나는 모습을 지켜봤다. 자신도 모르게 소매의 단추를 정돈했다.

segments.text: The screen suddenly lights up.
segments.translation: 화면에 갑자기 불이 들어왔다.

segments.text: Particle groups start to flow on the screen—it is a dream initiated by the owner of the body.
segments.translation: 화면에 입자군이 흐르기 시작했다. 몸의 주인이 스스로 시작한 꿈이었다.

segments.text: Huh?
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 어?

segments.text: In 388 B.C., standing in the garden paths of the Athens, there was an academia of philosophers.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 기원전 388년, 아테네의 정원길에 서서 철학자들의 아카데미아가 있었다.

segments.text: Thirty-six human ideologists present that day were thinking about the ever-present old question, just as you are ...
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 그날 참석한 서른여섯 명의 인간 사상가들은 당신과 마찬가지로 늘 존재해온 오래된 질문에 대해 생각하고 있었지...

segments.text: What passes knowledge? What maintains the world's balance?
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 지식이란 무엇을 전하는가? 세상의 균형을 유지하는 것은 무엇인가?

segments.text: Students, don't forget the exhortation from the philosophers.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 학생들아, 철학자들의 가르침을 잊지 마라.

segments.text: Heritage, honor, rationality, responsibility!
segments.speaker: All Students
segments.translation: 전통, 명예, 이성, 책임!

segments.text: The principal nods. He holds out his hands like a conductor.
segments.translation: 고개를 끄덕인 교장은 마치 지휘자처럼 두 팔을 벌렸다.

segments.text: This will be your lifelong pursuit.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 이것이 당신의 평생 과업이 될 것입니다.

segments.text: May the peace be with us. May the peace be with mankind!
segments.speaker: All Students
segments.translation: 평화가 우리와 함께하기를. 평화가 인류와 함께하기를!

segments.text: He's pleased with the responses.
segments.translation: 그는 이 대답들을 만족스러워했다.

segments.text: Last year, 45% of our graduates were chosen to work in the St. Pavlov Foundation headquarters. A particular excellent student has even been accepted by the House of Integratus.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 작년에 우리 졸업생의 45%가 성 파블로프 재단 본부에서 일하도록 선발되었습니다. 특히 우수한 학생 한 명은 통합의 집에서도 받아들여졌죠.

segments.text: The rest of the children, too, have become front-line investigators, staffs of Foundation office in other countries, or professional soldiers, dedicating themselves to the magnificent cause of mankind.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 나머지 아이들도 마찬가지로 최전선 조사원이 되거나, 타국 재단 사무소의 직원이 되거나, 전문 군인이 되어 인류의 위대한 대의에 자신을 바치고 있다네.

segments.text: For thousands of years, we have taken in countless young arcanists from workhouses and foundling hospitals, and have raised them to be outstanding students and models in every industry.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 수천 년 동안 우리는 구빈원과 고아원에서 수많은 젊은 마도사들을 받아들여, 그들을 모든 분야에서 뛰어난 학생이자 모범이 되도록 길러왔습니다.

segments.text: Soon, you will also be the backbone in preserving world order, and ...
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 곧 너도 세계 질서를 수호하는 중추가 될 것이고...

segments.text: ... Hmm?
segments.speaker: Principal

segments.text: There is one student standing out in the neat line of students.
segments.translation: 질서 정연한 학생 대열 속에서 한 학생의 모습이 유난히 눈에 띄었다.

segments.text: She is in the wrong line, or say, she is never in any lines.
segments.translation: 줄을 잘못 섰다. 아니면 애초에 줄을 선 적이 없는 것일 수도 있다.

segments.text: Sandwiched in between two neat lines, she looks like a pipe organ stop that has fallen out of place.
segments.translation: 두 줄의 정돈된 대열 사이에 끼어 있는 그녀의 모습은 마치 제자리를 벗어난 파이프 오르간의 음전 같았다.

segments.text: Do you have any questions, Vertin?
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 질문 있나, 버틴?

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아니요.

segments.text: Then why aren't you standing in the line?
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 그럼 왜 줄을 서지 않고 있는 거야?

segments.text: I'm sorry. I just wanted to see you clearly since your speech was so wonderful.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 미안해. 너무 멋진 연설이어서 너를 제대로 보고 싶었어.

segments.text: The principal watches Vertin walking quietly back to the line.
segments.translation: 교장이 버틴이 조용히 줄로 돌아가는 모습을 지켜보고 있다.

segments.text: Vertin, you are the youngest child we've ever taken in. You were just a month old when you came to the school.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 버틴, 너는 우리가 받아들인 아이들 중 가장 어렸단다. 학교에 왔을 때 겨우 한 달밖에 안 됐었지.

segments.text: And by now, you've spent almost 12 years in here.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 그리고 지금까지 여기서 거의 12년을 보냈군.

segments.text: I'd like to hear your thoughts since you are the most unique child in the school. Whatever the question or opinion is, I will respond with an answer.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 학교에서 가장 특별한 아이인 네 생각을 듣고 싶구나. 어떤 질문이든 의견이든 상관없이, 내가 답을 해주마.

segments.text: She stops.
segments.translation: 그녀는 걸음을 멈췄다.

segments.text: ... Any ... question?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: ...어떤... 질문이든?

segments.text: Of course, as you wish.
segments.speaker: Principal
segments.translation: 물론이지, 네 뜻대로 하자.

segments.text: What is the "Storm," sir?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 폭풍우가 뭔가요? 교장 선생님.

segments.text: *a piercing sound*
segments.translation: *날카로운 소리*

segments.text: May I ask ... how much further do we have to go?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 저기... 얼마나 더 가야 하는지 물어봐도 될까?

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 뭐?

segments.text: Till we get to the guardhouse ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 구금실까지 얼마나 남았나요...

segments.text: We're almost there. Don't worry.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 거의 다 왔어. 걱정하지 마.

segments.text: Ok.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 네.

segments.text: As your punishment, no dinner will be served tonight. You will stay here until tomorrow ... someone picks you up at noon.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 벌로 오늘 밤 저녁은 없다. 내일... 누군가 정오에 데리러 올 때까지 여기 있어라.

segments.text: I won't ask you how you knew "that word." But you have to promise that you won't mention it again.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 그 단어를 어떻게 알게 되었는지는 묻지 않겠다. 하지만 다시는 그 말을 입에 올리지 않겠다고 약속해야 한다.

segments.text: I promise.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 약속할게요.

segments.text: Alright, here we are.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 좋아, 도착했다.

segments.text: This is not some friendly place. The arcane skills I taught you before may help.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 여기는 그리 호의적인 곳이 아니야. 전에 가르쳐준 마도술이 도움이 될 거다.

segments.text: ... I hope you have paid close attention in that class.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: ... 그 수업을 잘 들었기를 바란다.

segments.text: The instructor gently pushs her back.
segments.translation: 교사가 살짝 밀었다.

segments.text: Get inside. Think carefully, or next time it won't be just confinement.
segments.speaker: Instructor
segments.translation: 들어가. 신중히 생각해, 다음엔 감금으로 끝나지 않을 테니까.

segments.text: A damp, muddy room.
segments.translation: 축축하고 진흙투성이인 방이었다.

segments.text: Water keeps dropping onto the ground intermittently.
segments.translation: 물이 간헐적으로 바닥에 계속 떨어지고 있었다.

segments.text: The ground is covered by old footprints in disarray.
segments.translation: 바닥은 온통 어지럽게 흩어진 오래된 발자국들로 덮여 있었다.

segments.text: Buzz, buzz.
segments.translation: 윙윙...

segments.text: Something is wiggling in the dark.
segments.translation: 어둠 속에서 뭔가 꿈틀거리고 있었다.

segments.text: This is ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 응? 이건...

segments.text: The Shamir worm?!
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 샤미르 애벌레?!

segments.text: Under the dim light, these worms, less than two inches, are crawling across the ground towards here.
segments.translation: 희미한 빛을 통해 2인치가 채 안 되는 크기의 벌레가 바닥을 따라 이쪽으로 기어오고 있다.

segments.text: So cool.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 굉장하다!

segments.text: It's said that the Shamirs are marvelous creatures, even King Solomon searched for them for years. They are incredible engravers—more skilled than the greatest craftsman among human. They can engrave on leaves, metal, and gemstones, build a sacred temple, or destroy a giant vessel.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 샤미르는 놀라운 생물이라고 해. 솔로몬 왕도 몇 년간 찾아다녔다더라. 정말 대단한 조각사들이야. 인간 중 최고의 장인보다도 뛰어나지. 나뭇잎이나 금속, 보석에 조각을 새길 수 있고, 신성한 신전을 짓거나 거대한 배를 부술 수도 있어.

segments.text: But now ... they have become tools for punishing naughty kids.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그런데 지금은... 아이를 벌주는 수단으로 전락한 건가.

segments.text: A round Shamir firstly crawls up her calf, interrupting her thoughts. It starts to do its work.
segments.translation: 종아리로 기어 올라와 작업을 시작한 동그란 샤미르가 생각을 방해했다.

segments.text: Urgh ...! It hurts.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아야...! 아파.

segments.text: There are at least a few hundred Shamirs here ... and they are all moving towards me.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 최소 몇백 마리는 있겠는데... 게다가 전부 내 쪽으로 기어오고 있잖아.

segments.text: The instructor did teach two incantations to repel insects, but Shamirs are not any ordinary worms. They are, in fact, a kind of advanced critter. The elementary arcane skills won't work on them ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 선생님이 벌레를 쫓는 주문 두 개는 가르쳐 주셨지만, 샤미르는 평범한 벌레가 아니야. 사실 고등 생물체의 일종이거든. 기초적인 마도술로는 통하지 않을 거야...

segments.text: Let alone there are no signs of my arcanum abilities up till now ... Maybe, I'm not an arcanist at all ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 게다가 난 지금까지 마도학 능력이 발현되지 않았어... 어쩌면, 애초에 마도학자가 아닐지도...

segments.text: The second Shamir has successfully landed on the moon! They are hardworking twins.
segments.translation: 두 번째 샤미르가 달에 성공적으로 착륙했다! 그들은 부지런한 쌍둥이였다.

segments.text: Ouch ...! Please don't bite me two times in a row!
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아야...! 연달아 물지 말아줘!

segments.text: No, stop, I have to focus now. There must be a way I can think of.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 안 돼, 안 돼. 집중하자. 분명 방법이 있을 거야.

segments.text: Patting the Shamirs off and thinking.
segments.translation: 몸에 붙은 샤미르를 털어내며 생각에 잠긴다.

segments.text: Water keeps dripping down from the side of the ceiling near the window. But, it hasn't rained for days.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 창 쪽의 천장에서 계속 물이 떨어지는데, 요 며칠 비가 온 적은 없었어.

segments.text: Here is a thin layer of mud on the ground. Judging from its volume, it's not likely to be brought in by other children who were once here for confinement.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 바닥에 얇은 진흙층이 있네. 양으로 봐서는 여기 감금됐던 다른 아이들이 가져온 건 아닌 것 같아.

segments.text: The dripping water has made the ground uneven. For these tiny worms, these descending areas are like impassable gulfs.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 떨어지는 물방울이 바닥을 울퉁불퉁하게 만들었어. 이 작은 벌레들에게 이런 움푹 패인 곳들은 건널 수 없는 심연과 같을 거야.

segments.text: ... Could the ground be left like this so as to slow down the worms and give us the time to cast incantations?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: ...바닥이 이렇게 된 건 벌레들의 속도를 늦춰서 우리에게 주문 영창 시간을 벌어주려는 걸까?

segments.text: But why would they gather around my feet ...?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그런데 왜 내 발밑으로 모여드는 거지...

segments.text: Hmm ... This is ...
segments.speaker: Vertin

segments.text: It is not mud on the ground. The floor is covered by a heap of grains and corns, which take up one square foot of the room.
segments.translation: 바닥에 있는 것은 진흙이 아니었다. 방 바닥은 곡물과 옥수수 알갱이들로 뒤덮여 있었고, 그것들이 방의 1평방피트를 차지하고 있었다.

segments.text: Under such dim lights, one can hardly realize that they are standing on a pile of mushy oat brans and corns.
segments.translation: 이런 흐릿한 빛 아래에서는 자신이 귀리 겨와 옥수수 같은 곡물 진창 위에 있다는 걸 알아차리기 힘들었다.

segments.text: Is this their food?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 이게 먹이인가?

segments.text: Turns out their route has been planned already.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 알고 보니 그들의 경로는 이미 계획되어 있었어.

segments.text: A yellow wool blanket lies in the other corner of the room. No Shamirs have yet approached there.
segments.translation: 방의 다른 쪽 구석에는 노란색 양모 담요가 놓여 있다. 아직 그곳에는 샤미르가 접근하지 않았다.

segments.text: Patting the Shamirs off and looking around.
segments.translation: 몸에 붙은 샤미르를 털어내고 사방을 둘러봤다.

segments.text: A yellow wool blanket lies in the other corner of the room. No Shamirs have ever approached there.
segments.translation: 방의 다른 쪽 구석에는 노란색 양모 담요가 놓여 있다. 그곳에는 샤미르가 한 번도 접근한 적이 없었다.

segments.text: Hop to there first.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 일단 어서 가보자.

segments.text: Phew ... Weird, why no Shamirs here?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 후우... 이상하네. 여긴 왜 샤미르가 없을까?

segments.text: Hm? These things sticking to my shoe are ... oat brans?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 음? 내 신발에 붙어있는 이것들은... 귀리 겨?

segments.text: Looking back at where she stood seconds ago, some grains are left scattered on the muddy ground.
segments.translation: 방금 전 서 있던 곳을 돌아보니 질퍽거리는 바닥 위로 곡식 낟알이 몇 개 흩어져 있었다.

segments.text: One can hardly see these with such dim lights.
segments.translation: 이런 어두운 조명으로는 거의 보이지 않는다.

segments.text: I've jumped over here, but the Shamirs just keep crawling towards the grains.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 여기로 뛰어왔지만, 샤미르들은 계속 곡물 쪽으로 기어가고 있어.

segments.text: Seems that they are not oriented by sounds. What matters to them is the grain.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 녀석들은 소리에 이끌리지 않나 봐. 곡물을 보물처럼 소중히 여길 뿐이지.

segments.text: But I can't stay here forever. There are foods in every corner. They will get here sooner or later.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 하지만 난 계속 여기 있을 수는 없어. 방 구석구석에 먹을 게 흩어져 있으니 녀석들이 언젠가 몰려올 거야.

segments.text: Itchiness on the leg. Some Shamirs fall on the wool blanket as Vertin pats them off, and hastily crawl away from the blanket.
segments.translation: 다리에서 간지러운 느낌이 들었다. 버틴이 샤미르들을 털어내자 몇 마리가 양모 러그 위로 떨어졌다가 서둘러 러그에서 기어 나갔다.

segments.text: Others are still wandering by the edge of the wool blanket.
segments.translation: 나머지는 양모 담요 가장자리에서 배회하고 있었다.

segments.text: Um, they can't do anything to this wool blanket?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 음, 양모 담요엔 손대지 못하나 보네?

segments.text: Wool ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 양모...

segments.text: Oh, so that's the case ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아, 그런 거였구나...

segments.text: The legend says that the way to store Shamir worms is to wrap them in wool and store them in a container made of lead,
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 전설에 따르면 샤미르 애벌레는 양모로 감싼 다음 납으로 만든 용기에 보관한다고 해,

segments.text: which means the wall of this room should be made of ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그렇다면 이 방의 벽 재료는...

segments.text: Picks up the wool blanket and wipes it on the wall. An off-white mark appears on the blanket.
segments.translation: 털 담요를 집어 들고 벽에 문지른다. 담요에 회백색 자국이 나타났다.

segments.text: It's alloy. Quickly forming a film on the surface—this has to be Lead(II) carbonate.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 합금이네. 표면에 빠르게 막이 형성되고 있어... 이건 탄산납(II)이 틀림없어.

segments.text: This is poisonous to them ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 녀석들에겐 독이나 다름없겠구나...

segments.text: Well, to me, as well.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 물론 나에게도 그렇지.

segments.text: This is when a handkerchief comes in handy. It would make a good mask and glove.
segments.translation: 이럴 때 손수건이 유용하다. 마스크와 장갑 역할을 해줄 것이다.

segments.text: I have everything I need. Grains to lure them and wools to drive them away.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 필요한 건 다 있어. 녀석들을 유인할 곡물과 쫓아낼 양모까지.

segments.text: The solutions are more than I expected.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 생각보다 방법이 다양하겠어.

segments.text: Alright, let's move! Expel them to the corner.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 좋아. 움직이자! 녀석들을 구석으로 몰아내는 거야.

segments.text: Finally, get them all to the corner.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 헉헉... 드디어 전부 구석으로 몰아냈네.

segments.text: Grr—
segments.translation: 으르렁—

segments.text: I'm a bit hungry.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 배가 좀 고프네.

segments.text: Oh right. I'll check what this padlock is made of and see if it can be consumed by the Shamirs ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아, 자물쇠가 무슨 재질로 만들어졌나 확인해보자. 샤미르가 갉아먹지 못하려나...

segments.text: Checks it under the lights.
segments.translation: 불빛 아래에서 그것을 확인한다.

segments.text: Very ordinary metal. It's just a common metal lock, with a bit of rust on the shackle.
segments.translation: 흔히 볼 수 있는 평범한 금속 자물쇠이며, 고리 부분에는 약간 녹슨 자국이 있다.

segments.text: I see. With plenty of food on the ground, Shamirs won't notice the ironware hanging above.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그런 거였구나. 먹을 게 충분하니까 샤미르도 높은 곳에 있는 철제품까지 신경 쓰지 않은 거야.

segments.text: Heh. Time to try a brand new dish, you old gentlemen.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 후훗, 새로운 메뉴를 맛볼 시간이랍니다, 신사 여러분.

segments.text: Closes the door of the room and sneaks through the hallway. There is no light in here.
segments.translation: 방문을 닫고 복도를 조심스럽게 지나간다. 이곳에는 불빛이 전혀 없다.

segments.text: There are two guardhouses on each side of the hallway.
segments.translation: 복도 양쪽에는 두 개의 경비실이 있다.

segments.text: Pass by the rooms, and the front gate would be ahead. There is no lock on the gate.
segments.translation: 방들을 지나면 정문이 앞에 보일 것이다. 문에는 자물쇠가 걸려 있지 않다.

segments.text: Psst-psssst!
A gray-eyed boy pops his head up at the cell window.
segments.translation: 회색 눈동자의 소년이 창문으로 머리를 내밀었다.

segments.text: ... Who are you?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: ...넌 누구야?

segments.text: I am "The Ring." I can catch anything with a toss.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 난 더 링이야. 던지기만 하면 뭐든 잡을 수 있어.

segments.text: Look!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 봐!

segments.text: He throws out an iron hoop, which is the size of a finger ring. The ring rolls over and clogs up Vertin's shoelaces.
segments.translation: 그는 손가락 반지만 한 크기의 철 고리를 던졌다. 고리가 굴러가더니 버틸의 신발끈에 걸렸다.

segments.text: So cool!
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 굉장하다!

segments.text: You can open these doors, can't you?
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 이 문들을 열 수 있지, 그렇지?

segments.text: Yes.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 네.

segments.text: Can you help me out of here? And I swear I will be at your service.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 여기서 나갈 수 있게 도와줄 수 있어? 그러면 맹세코 당신을 모시겠어.

segments.text: Cast that special skill of yours and open this lock on my door ...
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 네 특별한 마도술을 써서 내 문의 자물쇠를 열어줘...

segments.text: And so you can leave without a backward glance?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 나온 다음에는 뒤도 안 돌아보고 떠날 거지?

segments.text: Listen to you! I'm not going back in here again.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 네 말 좀 들어봐! 난 다시는 여기 들어가지 않을 거야.

segments.text: No way, then.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그럼 안 돼.

segments.text: Fine. Thought we are on the same boat.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 좋아. 우리가 같은 편인 줄 알았는데.

segments.text: If I let you out, will you come back?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 내보내 주면 다시 돌아올 거야?

segments.text: Of course not! Not even for a minute.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 당연히 아니지! 1분도 안 돼!

segments.text: But if you don't come back, the instructor will give us a harsher punishment.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 하지만 네가 돌아오지 않으면 선생님이 우리를 더 심하게 벌할 거야.

segments.text: I'm just sneaking out for food. I'll be back.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 나는 나가서 먹을 걸 찾아본 다음엔 다시 돌아올 거야.

segments.text: What would you like to have?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 뭐 먹고 싶은 거 있어?

segments.text: ... Fish and chips. Some onion vinaigrette on the side, if they have any.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: ... 피시 앤 칩스. 있다면 양파 비네그레트 소스도 곁들여서.

segments.text: No problem. I will bring some mashed peas too.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 문제없어. 완두콩 으깬 것도 가져다줄게.

segments.text: Three hours later
segments.translation: 3시간 후

segments.text: So you managed to control the Shamirs and got out?
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 그래서 샤미르들을 제어하고 빠져나온 거야?

segments.text: Yes. How about you? Any odd things in your room?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그래. 너는 어때? 네 방에 이상한 건 없었어?

segments.text: Nothing peculiar. Just some stinky rats. Didn't even take me long to take care of them.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 별거 아니야. 그냥 냄새나는 쥐새끼들이었어. 처리하는 데 오래 걸리지도 않았고.

segments.text: He shrugs his shoulders uncaringly and takes a good bite of the fish.
segments.translation: 별거 아니라는 듯 어깨를 으쓱하며 생선을 크게 베어 물었다.

segments.text: Nom-nom! The Staff Canteen does serve some good fish and chips ...
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 냠냠! 직원 식당에서 나오는 피시 앤 칩스 정말 맛있어...

segments.text: What you have in the Second Canteen is not even close to it! Keep missing the dressings and sometimes it's not even cod they fried!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 제2식당에 있는 건 그것과는 비교도 안 돼! 드레싱은 계속 빠뜨리고 때로는 튀긴 게 대구가 아닐 때도 있다고!

segments.text: Hmm ... So, why are you here?
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 흠... 그래서, 여기 왜 온 거야?

segments.text: ... I said "that word."
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: ...그 단어를 말했거든.

segments.text: What word?
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 무슨 말?

segments.text: "That word." I said it at the pre-parade assembly.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그 단어 말이야. 내가 순회공연에서 말했거든.

segments.text: Oooh, you mean the S-word? At the school assembly?
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 오오오, S로 시작하는 그 단어 말이야? 학교 조회 시간에?

segments.text: Hahahahahaha ...!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 하하하하하하하...!

segments.text: Good for you ... Hahaha ... The Big Head is gonna be so pissed!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 잘됐네... 하하하... 대가리가 완전 열받을 거야!

segments.text: *sighs* I don't understand ... It was he who said that I could ask any questions I want.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: *한숨* 이해가 안 돼... 뭐든지 궁금한 걸 물어봐도 된다고 말한 건 그 사람인데.

segments.text: Where did you learn "that word"?
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 그 말을 어디서 배웠지?

segments.text: I heard it from the janitor of our dormitory. That was the last thing he said.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 우리 기숙사 청소원한테서 들었어. 그 사람이 마지막으로 한 말이야.

segments.text: I saw him being escorted outside the school gate and onto a truck.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 교문 밖의 어느 차로 압송되는 걸 봤거든.

segments.text: He screamed all along, "The 'Storm' is coming ... The 'Storm' is coming ..."
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그 사람은 계속해서 폭풍우가 온다, 폭풍우가 온다라고 외쳤어.

segments.text: Er-m, I said it again ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 앗, 말해버렸다...

segments.text: ... Shoot.
segments.speaker: Vertin

segments.text: Never mind, keep going.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 신경 쓰지 마, 계속해.

segments.text: ... I asked many people, but none was bothered to answer. Uncle Morris said the janitor left the school at an inappropriate time and saw some inappropriate things, so he needed treatment.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: ...여러 사람한테 물어봤지만 아무도 대답해주지 않았어. 모리스 아저씨 말로는 청소원이 좋지 않은 시기에 학교를 벗어났다가 봐선 안 될 걸 봤대. 그래서 치료받으러 갔다고 했어.

segments.text: So I was right. The school is blocking the news feed.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 역시 내 생각이 맞았어. 학교에서 뉴스 피드를 차단하고 있는 거야.

segments.text: What do you mean?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 무슨 뜻이야?

segments.text: Look at this. I snuck this out from the staff office.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 이것 좀 봐. 직원 사무실에서 몰래 가져온 거야.

segments.text: THE WORLD-CHANGING "STORM": TRUTH COVERED BY THE FOUNDATION?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 세상을 바꾸는 폭풍우: 재단이 은폐한 진실?

segments.text: Yes. It wrote about a phenomenon called the "Storm," which will bring everybody in danger.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 그래. 그 책에는 폭풍우라고 불리는 현상에 대해 쓰여 있었는데, 모든 사람을 위험에 빠뜨릴 거라고 했어.

segments.text: Yet, the Foundation has stayed in silence about it. We are not allowed to say "that word." And this is the evidence.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 하지만 재단은 이에 대해 침묵을 지키고 있어. 우리는 그 단어를 말하는 것이 허용되지 않거든. 그리고 이것이 바로 그 증거야.

segments.text: The newspaper has already become soft in hand after all the foldings. Some of its printings have even become blurry.
segments.translation: 신문지는 계속 접다 보니 손에서 이미 부드러워져 있었다. 인쇄된 글자 중 일부는 심지어 흐릿해져 있었다.

segments.text: It doesn't tell us exactly what "that word" is, either.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 신문에서도 그 단어가 대체 뭔지 명확히 말하질 않아.

segments.text: There's a line in bold at the end of the article ... "Welcome to Manus Vindictae"?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 문장 끝에 굵게 표시된 작은 글자가 있는데... 재건의 손에 들어오세요?

segments.text: What’s Manus Vindictae?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 재건의 손은 뭐야?

segments.text: Dunno, never heard of it.
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 몰라, 들어본 적 없어.

segments.text: Something has been printed on the back too. Hmm, let me see ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 뒷면에도 뭔가 인쇄되어 있네. 음, 어디 보자...

segments.text: Nor happiness, nor harmony, nor fame,
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 행복도, 화합도, 명성도,

segments.text: Nor pride, nor strength, nor skill in arms or arts,
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 자존심도, 힘도, 무술이나 기예의 기량도,

segments.text: Shepherd those herds whom blindness makes tame;
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 순응하고 맹종하는 가축 떼를 돌보라고;

segments.text: The night is quiet.
segments.translation: 밤은 고요했다.

segments.text: Yet disturbances are about to come out of the dark.
segments.translation: 다만, 소란은 더 이상 어둠 속에 몸을 숨기지 않았다.

segments.text: Squeak, squeak.
segments.translation: 찍찍...

segments.text: What's going on? Great, the chips have brought in more rats!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 뭔 일이야? 젠장, 미끼 때문에 쥐새끼들이 더 몰려왔잖아!

segments.text: Vertin? Vertin!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 버틴? 버틴!

segments.text: Do you have to drift off now? Come over and help!
segments.speaker: “The Ring”
segments.translation: 지금 딴 생각할 때야? 이리 와서 도와줘!

segments.text: Someone is at the door.
segments.translation: 누군가 문밖에 서 있다.

segments.text: Madam Vice President.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 부회장님.

segments.text: Holding a chess piece of bishop in her hand, Constantine doesn't even bother to look up.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴은 손에 비숍 체스 말을 쥔 채 고개를 들어보려고도 하지 않았다.

segments.text: Come in.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 들어와.

segments.text: Here is the monthly department report.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이번 달 부서 보고가 올라왔습니다.

segments.text: Any news I shouldn't miss?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 놓치면 안 될 소식이 있나?

segments.text: The mainstream media in Europe are on our side and have no extra coverage on the issue. In fact, as long as there is no tangible evidence, they won't act upon this rashly.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 유럽의 주류 언론들은 우리 편이고 이 문제에 대해 추가 보도를 하지 않을 거야. 사실 확실한 증거가 없는 한, 그들도 성급하게 행동하지는 않을 테니까.

segments.text: The "Storm" ... hasn't come to this era yet.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 폭풍우는... 아직 이 시대에 찾아오지 않았습니다.

segments.text: For most of the people, what Manus Vindictae has said in their pamphlets is totally unfounded and ludicrous.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 대부분의 사람들에겐 재건의 손의 주장은 황당무계한 소리일 뿐이죠.

segments.text: Constantine gets on her feet.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴이 자리에서 일어났다.

segments.text: They have been making quite a scene here and there, as I heard.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 내가 듣기로는 여기저기서 꽤 소란을 피우고 다니던데.

segments.text: Yes. Residents nearby have all received their pamphlets. Even the SPDM (School of Primary Defense of Mankind) has reported some cases.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 네, 인근 주민이 녀석들의 홍보물을 받았습니다. 제1 방어선 학교에서도 해당 사례가 보고되었습니다.

segments.text: Affected by the time reversion, our manpower and resources have become much less than before. It will take us a long time to complete the city-wide air defense system.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 시간 역행의 영향으로 우리의 인력과 자원이 이전보다 훨씬 부족해졌어. 도시 전체의 방공 시스템을 완성하는 데 상당한 시간이 걸릴 거야.

segments.text: Were these pamphlets airdropped?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 이 전단지들이 공중 투하된 건가?

segments.text: Yes, most of them were.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 네, 대부분은 그렇습니다.

segments.text: Give me the visual of the "ariel carriers" of Manus Vindictae.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 재건의 손의 공중 수송기 영상을 보여줘.

segments.text: These are Olitiaus. Their sizes are about four to six feet, covered mostly in black.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 오리티우 무리이며, 대략 4~6피트 크기에 대부분 검은색을 띠고 있습니다.

segments.text: They have a similar appearance to manta rays and have good manoeuvrability and explosive power.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 생긴 건 쥐가오리와 흡사하고, 뛰어난 기동성과 폭발력을 지니고 있습니다.

segments.text: Olitiau 04. This type of Olitiau has limited operation range and cannot take a long-haul. They are too dependent on the water.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 올리티아우 04. 이 종류의 올리티아우는 작전 범위가 제한적이고 장거리 운항이 불가능해. 물에 너무 의존적이거든.

segments.text: Indeed. According to our report, they usually leave after a three-hour hovering every day.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그렇습니다. 관찰 보고에 따르면 매일 상공에서 세 시간 정도 선회하다 떠난다고 합니다.

segments.text: Heh-heh ...
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 헤헤헤...

segments.text: Ms. Z, where do you see fit for this bishop ...?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: Z씨, 이 비숍을 어디에 두는 게 좋을까요...?

segments.text: Hmm ...
segments.speaker: Z

segments.text: I think it should go to b5.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: b5로 가야 할 것 같습니다.

segments.text: Yes, I thought the same.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 네, 저도 같은 생각이었습니다.

segments.text: Olitiaus are highly adequate for low-altitude aerial reconnaissance surveys. But they are only found in the southern part of Cameroon and difficult to capture. It is a very rare arcane species.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 올리티아우스는 저고도 항공 정찰 조사에 매우 적합해. 하지만 카메룬 남부에서만 발견되고 포획하기도 어려워. 아주 희귀한 마도술 종이지.

segments.text: Sending these many Olitiaus on such short notice ... I would presume Manus Vindictae has already established a command post somewhere nearby.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 이렇게 많은 올리티아우들을 급작스럽게 보내다니... 재건의 손이 이미 근처 어딘가에 지휘소를 설치해 둔 것 같군.

segments.text: I don't see how this is helpful. As they said themselves, the "Storm" is coming ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 의미 없는 일 아닙니까. 재건 스스로 폭풍우가 온다고 말했으니...

segments.text: What do you say if this new command post of theirs, like our headquarters ...
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 만약 그들의 새로운 지휘부가 우리 본부처럼...

segments.text: is a building that will not be affected by the "Storm"?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 폭풍우의 영향을 받지 않는 건물이라는 건가?

segments.text: They need to make sure that Olitiaus won't be affected by the "Storm" ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 놈들은 오리티우가 폭풍우의 영향을 받지 않게 해야겠죠...

segments.text: I think you know what to do, Ms. Z.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 어떻게 해야 할지 알고 있을 거야, Z 양.

segments.text: Take over the initiative, find their location.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 주도권을 잡고 놈들의 위치를 찾아내는 겁니다.

segments.text: Exactly. Send a scout squad to follow the Olitiaus and get the others to search in the water catchment areas within 100 miles from here.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 맞다. 정찰대를 보내 올리티아우스들을 추적하게 하고, 나머지는 이곳에서 100마일 이내의 집수 지역을 수색하도록 해.

segments.text: We are going behind their front lines, just like this bishop ...
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 우리는 저들의 전선 뒤로 돌아갈 거야, 마치 이 비숍처럼 말이지...

segments.text: I will forward these to the Secretary of the Army.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이 내용들을 육군 장관에게 전달하겠습니다.

segments.text: Make a copy to the Pax House as well.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 팍스 하우스에도 사본을 보내도록 해.

segments.text: ... Copy that.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: ...알겠습니다.

segments.text: What about the school's air defense?
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 학교의 방공 안전은 어떻게 할까요?

segments.text: There have been rumors in school. I'm worried the students might be affected.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 학교 안에 소문이 떠돈다고 합니다. 학생들이 영향을 받을까 봐 우려되는군요.

segments.text: Send Zeno's air force trainees to the school.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 제노의 공군 훈련생들을 학교로 보내.

segments.text: Affirmative. Olitiaus are crafty creatures. I will pick those who are equipped with field experience.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그렇습니다. 올리티아우스들은 교활한 생물이니까요. 현장 경험이 풍부한 인원들로 선발하겠습니다.

segments.text: Constantine does not respond.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴은 대답하지 않았다.

segments.text: She stares at the black king on the board and broods.
segments.translation: 그녀는 체스판 위의 블랙 킹을 바라보며 깊은 상념에 빠진다.

segments.text: We need someone to forecast the "Storm."
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 폭풍우를 예측할 사람이 필요해.

segments.text: Hah ...! Finally got to let my baby Su-01ве out for a ride. It feels right!
